definitions.text: a request by the manufacturer of a defective product to return the product (as for replacement or repair)
a bugle call that signals troops to return
the process of remembering (especially the process of recovering information by mental effort)
examples: he has total recall of the episode

definitions.text: the act of removing an official by petition
recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection
examples: I can't remember saying any such thing
I can't think what her last name was
can you remember her phone number?
Do you remember that he once loved you?
This harks back to a previous remark of his
His words echoed John F. Kennedy
The ambassador was recalled to his country
The company called back many of the workers it had laid off during the recession

definitions.text: cause one's (or someone else's) thoughts or attention to return from a reverie or digression
examples: She was recalled by a loud laugh

definitions.text: make unavailable; bar from sale or distribution
examples: The company recalled the product when it was found to be faulty
The manufacturer tried to call back the spoilt yoghurt
